meanings.definition: Not kosher; not permitted to be eaten according to Jewish dietary laws.
meanings.sent1: The food was considered treyf because it contained forbidden ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The treyf meat was not suitable for the religious ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The treyf dish caused quite a stir at the dinner party.
meanings.sent4: Her treyf actions went against everything she believed in.
meanings.sent5: The treyf label on the package warned observant consumers not to buy it.

meanings.sent1: The treyf water in the pond was not safe for drinking.
meanings.sent2: The treyf kitchen needed a thorough cleaning.
meanings.sent3: His treyf hands left marks all over the clean paper.
meanings.sent4: The treyf thoughts clouded his mind with negativity.
meanings.sent5: The treyf smell coming from the garbage made her gag.

meanings.sent1: The treyf behavior of the politician shocked the public.
meanings.sent2: The treyf decision weighed heavily on his conscience.
meanings.sent3: Her treyf words hurt more than any physical pain.
meanings.sent4: The treyf intentions behind the gift were revealed in time.
meanings.sent5: The treyf atmosphere of the place made her uncomfortable.
